thread.title: Balcony collapses at Winston Hills home in Sydney, leaving three injured
thread.title_full: Balcony collapses at Winston Hills home in Sydney, leaving three injured

author: Lauren Thomson
title: Balcony collapses at Winston Hills home in Sydney, leaving three injured
text:
Three people have been rushed to hospital after a balcony collapsed at a home in Sydney’s north-west.
Emergency crews were called to the property on Rebecca Pde in Winston Hills just after 1pm on Thursday, finding two adults and a teenager injured in the fall.
Multiple paramedics treated the trio at the scene before transporting them to hospital.
Know the news with the 7NEWS app: Download today
7NEWS.com.au understands all three were standing on the deck before its sudden collapse.
NSW Ambulance confirmed to 7NEWS.com.au that a woman in her 60s suffered neck, head and shoulder injuries, while a man in his 30s sustained arm injuries
A teenage boy was also treated for minor abrasions.
The adults were taken to Westmead Hospital, with the teen transported to The Children’s Hospital at Westmead.
All three are in a stable condition.
Fire and Rescue NSW crews worked alongside paramedics, helping stabilise the patients and secure the area.
A spokesperson told 7NEWS.com.au that it took about an hour to treat and move the injured, with one patient carried out on a stretcher.
The cause of the collapse remains unclear, and the structural integrity of the home will be assessed at a later stage.
